content.rendered:
Law Firm Website Designer

Dan Gilroy / President / Creative Director

Dan Gilroy’s work as a law firm website designer has spanned nearly twenty years. Working with law firms came naturally to us as Dan has significant experience working in law firms and directly with attorneys. Following college, Dan worked in Washington, D.C., for sixteen years. He worked three years on Capitol Hill for the U.S. Senate Committee on Finance, followed by thirteen years at venerable law firms like White & Case LLP and Patton Boggs & Blow (now Squire Patton Boggs). Dan also comes from a family of lawyers. The one he admired most was his father, The Honorable Patrick D. Gilroy.

Dan’s considerable experience in the legal market makes him uniquely equipped to understand the needs of attorneys and law firms when designing websites. He has worked in large law firms, mid-sized law firms, and small law offices. He understands lawyers and law firm culture. All assets that, to this day, help in each law firm website project Dan Gilroy Design takes on.

Dan possesses various technical and creative skills that he has sharpened over the last twenty-five years. He is a proud self-taught website coder and thus brings strong front-end coding skills to his projects. He is adept at desktop and mobile website development, custom WordPress theme design, building positive user experiences, lawyer SEO, law firm logo design, and copywriting. Our clients say his exceptional people skills make him a delight to work with.

Dan Gilroy Design emphasizes being ultra-responsive to client requests – a service that is prized by our long-time clients and as evidenced by their positive reviews. Dan Gilroy Design’s service-oriented approach has distinguished our firm among peers, and our strong growth from client referrals is the best evidence that our approach is working.

Feel free to reach out: hello@dangilroy.com

Dan lives and works in West Linn, Oregon, a suburb just south of Portland. He enjoys a full life with his wife and two kids. When Dan’s not running his business, you may find him wearing one of several hats, including doting father, chef, chauffeur, coach, cheerleader, banker, study buddy, and loving husband. He has his hands in various volunteer roles and is a current board member and former President of the Friends of St. Agatha educational trust.
